column4: hi, does anyone know the command for showing the current processes with CPU usage like the one that you can see in M$ windows?
what program will run python at the background all the time in Ubuntu? it eats up 30% of my CPU usage all the time, is it X-Chat?
find the pid in top, then use 'ps auxf' to see the tree of processes, so you can see who the parent is.
how do you see that? it's pretty confusing
omg...found it...the gdesklets is eating up my resources...
er, it will never ever be in multiverse or universe
because it's supported software, and thus goes in main
in main? I don't find it either.
yes, indeed it hasnt been updated yet, breezy is undergoing other more important changes
so I just need to wait until the main updates?
